column4: I am having an error while downloading anything using apt error is: dpkg-deb: subprocess paste killed by signal (Broken pipe)
anybody help
ya, dpkg error processing mysql-cluster-client*  and many more
here's a workaround not a fix  http://techspalace.blogspot.com/2009/04/offline-update-ubuntu.html
http://paste.ubuntu.com/439544/
was this from running download or my suggestion for offline backup?
running downloading
i tried to install some packages of mysql-cluster-client but it flashes some error
ah.  well, my solution specifically was to avoid this via offline backup.
the errors i see appear to be dpkg errors.  theere's a fix command - lemme look
i tried sudo apt-get install -f but it didnt work
sudo dpkg --configure -a [try to fix broken packages]
dpkg: status database area is locked by another process
sudo apt-get -f install [try to fix broken packages]
i tried but didn't worked
shut down update/synaptic
http://files.fosswire.com/2008/04/ubunturef.pdf  save for reference
http://paste.ubuntu.com/439549/
dependcies are incomplete.  you need the packages that are not installed.  either synaptic or terminal line "sudo apt-get install packagenamehere"
http://paste.ubuntu.com/439552/

ouch.  yeah, i've got the "will not be installed" error once or twice and i don't remember how I got around it.  Howzaboutthis; sudo apt-get purge mysql-cluster-client to remove all pieces.  Then use synaptic to reinstall.  If that doesn't work, don't know what else to try.  sorry.
thats not a problem dude, i 'll try
